meanings.definition: To lift or raise with effort or force.
meanings.sent1: I had to hoise the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers hoise the flag up the pole every morning.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hoise the cat into the bathtub was quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She hoised her spirits by listening to uplifting music.
meanings.sent5: The superhero hoised the car effortlessly to save the trapped kitten.

meanings.definition: A lifting or raising mechanism, such as a pulley or crane.
meanings.sent1: The hoise in the construction site helped move heavy materials.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Egyptians used hoises to build the pyramids.
meanings.sent3: The hoise in the playground made the children's games more exciting.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the hoise that lifted him out of poverty.
meanings.sent5: The hoise on the ship was essential for loading and unloading cargo.
